tasks.task: To grow firecracker chili peppers, select a sunny location with at least 6-8 hours of direct sunlight. Ensure well-drained soil with a pH between 6.2 and 7.0. Start seeds indoors 6-8 weeks before the last frost, or direct sow after frost. Transplant seedlings once they have two true leaves and soil reaches 60°F, spacing them 18-24 inches apart. Regular watering is needed to keep the soil moist but not overly warm. Additional tasks include monitoring soil pH, drainage, and temperature, as well as keeping track of frost dates for appropriate planting times. Transplanting seedlings involves verifying their leaf development and soil temperature before carefully moving them to the garden with proper spacing.
